world

Class SimpleWorldObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • world.SimpleWorldObject
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    NullSimpleWorldObject

    public abstract class SimpleWorldObject
extends java.lang.Object
    The "global" object for the SimpleWorld that can render ontop of the screen. This class has one method that the user overrides to paint over the screen.
    Author:
    Brian Nakayama

        public SimpleWorldObject()

    • Method Detail

      • updateScreen

        public abstract void updateScreen(java.awt.image.BufferedImage bi,
                java.awt.Graphics2D g)
        Update screen using the graphics or by directly manipulating the pixels. Game logic held in SimpleWorldObject should also be updated here.
        Parameters:
        bi - The BufferedImage on which the other objects are drawn.
        g - The graphics context for the BufferedImage.

      • playSound

        public void playSound(java.lang.String sound)
        Play a sound. This is the convenience method not the recommended one. See SimpleObject's implementation for more details. Also, TrackPlayer.play(Sound) can be used to play sounds directly.
        Parameters:
        sound - The path to the sound.
        See Also:
        SimpleObject.playSound(String)

      • loadImageResources

        public boolean loadImageResources(java.lang.String spriteFile)
        Preload all of the images in a folder.
        Parameters:
        spriteFile - The directory with the images to be loaded.
        Returns:
        True if the images were loaded successfully.

      • loadSoundResources

        public boolean loadSoundResources(java.lang.String soundFile)
        Preload all of the sound resources in a folder.
        Parameters:
        soundFile - The directory with the sounds to be loaded.
        Returns:
        True if the sounds were loaded successfully.
